questions: What is meant by power of a lens ? Define its SI unit.
answers: The power of a lens is defined as the reciprocal of its focal length  expressed in metres. SI unit of power is dioptre. One dioptre is defined as the power of a lens whose focal length is 1 metre.

answers: Four characteristics will be virtual, magnified, erect and image is formed behind the lens.

questions: State four characteristics of the image formed by plane mirror.
answers: Image distance = Object distance  Size of the image = Size of the object  Image is laterally inverted  Image is always virtual and erect.

questions: What is meant by the power of a lens ? Give its SI unit. When two or more lenses are placed in contact what will be their combined power ?
answers: The reciprocal of the focal length of a lens is termed as power of lens. It is expressed in metres. SI unit is dioptre. The combined power will be equal to the algebraic sum of their individual powers.

questions: Briefly describe an activity to find approximate focal length of a convex lens.
answers: The lens is placed along the path of light–either sun rays or through electric lamp. The rays converge at a point. The distance between converging point and lens is measured which gives the rough focal length of the convex lens.
